item.title: Bridging the 4th industrial revolution in South Africa
item.description: What Government strategies may be implemented in South Africa in order to bridge the gap in income inequality through successful policing of the 4thIndustrial Revolution? The 4th industrial revolution is an inevitable phenomenon which is currently shaping the future of our world economy. What we are yet to find out the impact that it will have on our world economies, especially regarding the implications it may have on inequality.

item.title: Evaluating Rain's Marketing Strategy
item.description: “On the societal front, a paradigm shift is underway in how we work and communicate, as well as how we express, inform and entertain ourselves.” This is quote from Klaus Schwab’s (2016) novel “The Fourth Industrial Revolution”, which strongly correlates to the strong increase of online presence during COVID-19. As the pandemic hit the masses, there was an increase in demand for access to the internet and telecommunications companies had to meet these demands. This essay will focus on the South African company, Rain, which is based on mobile data sales and delivers fast and affordable internet. By observing Rain’s marketing mix, we shall understand how Rain made the most of the lockdown. Firstly, we shall look at the company and discern the products they produce, then examine Rain’s strategic pricing methods, placement and promotion. Afterwards, we shall examine process, physical evidence and people, as Rain is a service company.
